author: Geoffrey Seiler
description: Apple has created a strong closed-loop business model that seamlessly connects its devices and keeps its content within its walled garden. This has led to a locked-in user base and high-margin service revenue growth, but the company faces potential risks from its revenue-sharing agreement with Alphabet.

author: Anthony Di Pizio
description: The Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) has consistently outperformed the S&P 500 since its inception in 2004. The author predicts the ETF will continue to outperform in 2025 due to the growing influence of artificial intelligence (AI) on its top holdings, including Apple, Nvidia, and Microsoft.
insights: [{'sentiment': 'positive', 'sentiment_reasoning': 'The ETF has outperformed the S&P 500 every year since its establishment in 2004, and the author predicts it will continue to do so in 2025 due to the growing influence of AI on its top holdings.', 'ticker': 'VGT'}, {'sentiment': 'positive', 'sentiment_reasoning': "Apple's recent launch of AI-powered features for its devices and its potential work on a humanoid robot could drive further upside for the company and the Vanguard ETF.", 'ticker': 'AAPL'}, {'sentiment': 'positive', 'sentiment_reasoning': 'Nvidia is the AI hardware king, and its latest Blackwell GPUs are expected to be in high demand from companies like Microsoft and Oracle, which operate AI data centers.', 'ticker': 'NVDA'}, {'sentiment': 'positive', 'sentiment_reasoning': 'Microsoft is experiencing high demand for its AI data centers, which should continue to drive its cloud revenue and earnings growth, benefiting the Vanguard ETF.', 'ticker': 'MSFT'}]
title: Prediction: This Unstoppable Vanguard ETF Will Beat the S&P 500 Again in 2025
